content.description: The moves are V2/3 but the extended period of time it takes to complete the traverse contribute to the v4 grade. Start on the East side corner of the wall and start traversing to the left as the wall increases in height. Start section is a little difficult due to the lack of space. Middle section is rife with rest opportunities and rewards good movement. Crux comes as you reach the last 5 ‘blocks’ on the western face. Bring a crashpad and a buddy, or scope out where you think you’ll go high on the wall and place pad(s) there.
content.location: The wall is hard to miss. It is the only man-made stone wall overlooking the river off of Oregon Hill Parkway in Richmond, VA. The start is at the side closest to the bridge and the traverse goes left until you reach the other end of the wall.

content.description: A stone wall forming the base of the Oregon Hill Overlook in Richmond, VA. The wall faces south and gets direct sun in the middle of the day. The length of the wall is approximately 50 feet, but the wall is slightly curved. The tallest part of the wall is approximately 12-15 feet above the ground.
